◆ pos_extra()

int32_t pos_extra ( locstruc *  loc)

Calculate Extra position information.

Calculate things like sun position and insolation, and elements that are used in conversion, like libration and J2000 rotation matrices.

Parameters
loclocstruc with the current position and those to be updated.
92 {
93  // Don't perform if time is invalid

◆ pos_icrf()

int32_t pos_icrf ( locstruc *  loc)

Set Barycentric position.

Set the current time and position to whatever is in the Barycentric position of the locstruc. Then propagate to all the other positions.

Parameters
loclocstruc with the current position and those to be updated.
142 {
143  int32_t iretn;
144  double distance, theta;
145  rvector sat2body;
146 
147  // Synchronize time
148  if (loc->pos.icrf.utc == 0.)
149  {
150  if (!std::isfinite(loc->utc))
151  {
152  return CONVERT_ERROR_UTC;
153  }
154  loc->pos.icrf.utc = loc->pos.utc = loc->utc;
155  }
156  else
157  {
158  if (!std::isfinite(loc->pos.icrf.utc))
159  {
160  return CONVERT_ERROR_UTC;
161  }
162  loc->utc = loc->pos.utc = loc->pos.icrf.utc;
163  }
164 
165  iretn = pos_extra(loc);
166  if (iretn < 0)
167  {
168  return iretn;
169  }
170 
171  // Determine closest planetary body
172  loc->pos.extra.closest = COSMOS_EARTH;
173  if (length_rv(rv_sub(loc->pos.icrf.s,loc->pos.extra.sun2moon.s)) < length_rv(rv_sub(loc->pos.icrf.s,loc->pos.extra.sun2earth.s)))
174  loc->pos.extra.closest = COSMOS_MOON;
175 
176  // Set SUN specific stuff
177  distance = length_rv(loc->pos.icrf.s);
178  loc->pos.sunsize = (float)(RSUNM/distance);
179  loc->pos.sunradiance = (float)(3.839e26/(4.*DPI*distance*distance));
180 
181  // Check Earth:Sun separation
182  sat2body = rv_sub(loc->pos.icrf.s,loc->pos.extra.sun2earth.s);
183  loc->pos.earthsep = (float)(sep_rv(loc->pos.icrf.s,sat2body));
184  loc->pos.earthsep -= (float)(asin(REARTHM/length_rv(sat2body)));
185  if (loc->pos.earthsep < -loc->pos.sunsize)
186  loc->pos.sunradiance = 0.;
187  else
188  if (loc->pos.earthsep <= loc->pos.sunsize)
189  {
190  theta = DPI*(loc->pos.sunsize+loc->pos.earthsep)/loc->pos.sunsize;
191  loc->pos.sunradiance *= (float)((theta - sin(theta))/D2PI);
192  }
193 
194  // Set Moon specific stuff
195  sat2body = rv_sub(loc->pos.icrf.s,loc->pos.extra.sun2moon.s);
196 
197  // Check Earth:Moon separation
198  loc->pos.moonsep = (float)(sep_rv(loc->pos.icrf.s,sat2body));
199  loc->pos.moonsep -= (float)(asin(RMOONM/length_rv(sat2body)));
200  if (loc->pos.moonsep < -loc->pos.sunsize)
201  loc->pos.sunradiance = 0.;
202  else
203  if (loc->pos.moonsep <= loc->pos.sunsize)
204  {
205  theta = DPI*(loc->pos.sunsize+loc->pos.moonsep)/loc->pos.sunsize;
206  loc->pos.sunradiance *= (float)((theta - sin(theta))/D2PI);
207  }
208 
209  // Set related attitudes
210  loc->att.icrf.pass = loc->pos.icrf.pass;
211  loc->att.icrf.utc = loc->pos.icrf.utc;
212 
213  // Set adjoining positions
214  if (loc->pos.icrf.pass > loc->pos.eci.pass)
215  {
216  pos_icrf2eci(loc);
217  pos_eci(loc);
218  }
219  if (loc->pos.icrf.pass > loc->pos.sci.pass)
220  {
221  pos_icrf2sci(loc);
222  pos_sci(loc);
223  }
224  return 0;
225 }

239  {
240  return CONVERT_ERROR_UTC;
241  }
242  loc->pos.eci.utc = loc->pos.utc = loc->utc;
243  }
244  else
245  {
246  if (!std::isfinite(loc->pos.eci.utc))
247  {
248  return CONVERT_ERROR_UTC;
249  }
250  loc->utc = loc->pos.utc = loc->pos.eci.utc;
251  }
252 
253  iretn = pos_extra(loc);
254  if (iretn < 0)
255  {
256  return iretn;
257  }
258 
259  // Set adjoining positions
260  if (loc->pos.eci.pass > loc->pos.icrf.pass)
261  {
262  pos_eci2icrf(loc);
263  pos_icrf(loc);
264  }
265  if (loc->pos.eci.pass > loc->pos.geoc.pass)
266  {
267  pos_eci2geoc(loc);
268  pos_geoc(loc);
269  }
270 
271  // Set related attitude
272  loc->att.icrf.pass = loc->pos.eci.pass;
273  return 0;
274 }

◆ pos_icrf2eci()

int32_t pos_icrf2eci ( locstruc *  loc)

Convert Barycentric to ECI.

Propagate the position found in the Barycentric slot of the supplied locstruc to the Earth Centered Inertial slot, performing all relevant updates.

Parameters
locWorking locstruc
566 {
567  int32_t iretn;
568  // Synchronize time
569  if (loc->pos.icrf.utc == 0.)
570  {
571  if (!std::isfinite(loc->utc))
572  {
573  return CONVERT_ERROR_UTC;
574  }
575  loc->pos.icrf.utc = loc->pos.utc = loc->utc;
576  }
577  else
578  {
579  if (!std::isfinite(loc->pos.icrf.utc))
580  {
581  return CONVERT_ERROR_UTC;
582  }
583  loc->utc = loc->pos.utc = loc->pos.icrf.utc;
584  }
585 
586  // Update extra information
587  iretn = pos_extra(loc);
588  if (iretn < 0)
589  {
590  return iretn;
591  }
592 
593  // Update time
594  loc->pos.eci.utc = loc->utc;
595 
596  // Update pass
597  loc->pos.eci.pass = loc->pos.icrf.pass;
598 
599  // Heliocentric to Geocentric Ecliptic
600  loc->pos.eci.s = loc->pos.eci.v = loc->pos.eci.a = rv_zero();
601 
602  loc->pos.eci.s = rv_sub(loc->pos.icrf.s,loc->pos.extra.sun2earth.s);
603  loc->pos.eci.v = rv_sub(loc->pos.icrf.v,loc->pos.extra.sun2earth.v);
604  loc->pos.eci.a = rv_sub(loc->pos.icrf.a,loc->pos.extra.sun2earth.a);
605  return 0;
606 }

756 {

800  loc->pos.geoc.a = rv_add(loc->pos.geoc.a,v2);
801  // Apply third order correction due to second derivative of rotation matrix
802  v2 = rv_mmult(loc->pos.extra.ddj2e,loc->pos.eci.s);

806  pos_geoc2geod(loc);
807

◆ pos_geoc2geos()

int32_t pos_geoc2geos ( locstruc *  loc)

Convert GEOC to GEOS.

Convert a Geocentric cartpos to a Geographic spherpos.

Parameters
loclocstruc containing position.
893 {
894  double xvx, yvy, r2, r, minir, minir2;
895  double cp, cl, sl, sp;
896 
897  // Synchronize time
898  if (0. == loc->pos.geoc.utc)
899  {
900  if (!std::isfinite(loc->utc))
901  {
902  return CONVERT_ERROR_UTC;
903  }
904  loc->pos.geoc.utc = loc->pos.utc = loc->utc;
905  }
906  else
907  {
908  if (!std::isfinite(loc->pos.geoc.utc))
909  {
910  return CONVERT_ERROR_UTC;
911  }
912  loc->utc = loc->pos.utc = loc->pos.geoc.utc;
913  }
914 
915  // Update time
916  loc->pos.geos.utc = loc->utc;
917 
918  // Update pass
919  loc->pos.geos.pass = loc->pos.geoc.pass;
920 
921  // Convert Geocentric Cartesian to Spherical
922  minir2 = loc->pos.geoc.s.col[0]*loc->pos.geoc.s.col[0]+loc->pos.geoc.s.col[1]*loc->pos.geoc.s.col[1];
923  minir = sqrt(minir2);
924  r2 = minir2+loc->pos.geoc.s.col[2]*loc->pos.geoc.s.col[2];
925  loc->pos.geos.s.r = r = sqrt(r2);
926  sp = loc->pos.geoc.s.col[2]/r;
927  loc->pos.geos.s.phi = asin(sp);
928  loc->pos.geos.s.lambda = atan2(loc->pos.geoc.s.col[1],loc->pos.geoc.s.col[0]);
929 
930  xvx = loc->pos.geoc.s.col[0]*loc->pos.geoc.v.col[0];
931  yvy = loc->pos.geoc.s.col[1]*loc->pos.geoc.v.col[1];
932  loc->pos.geos.v.r = (xvx+yvy+loc->pos.geoc.s.col[2]*loc->pos.geoc.v.col[2])/r;
933  loc->pos.geos.v.phi = (-(xvx+yvy) * loc->pos.geoc.s.col[2] + minir2*loc->pos.geoc.v.col[2])/(r2*minir);
934  //loc->pos.geos.v.lambda = -(loc->pos.geoc.s.col[0]*loc->pos.geoc.v.col[1]+loc->pos.geoc.s.col[1]*loc->pos.geoc.v.col[0])/minir2;
935 
936  cp = minir / r;
937  cl = loc->pos.geoc.s.col[0] / minir;
938  sl = loc->pos.geoc.s.col[1] / minir;
939  if (fabs(loc->pos.geoc.s.col[1]) > fabs(loc->pos.geoc.s.col[0]))
940  loc->pos.geos.v.lambda = (loc->pos.geoc.v.col[0] - cp * cl * loc->pos.geos.v.r + loc->pos.geoc.s.col[2] * cl * loc->pos.geos.v.phi) / (-loc->pos.geoc.s.col[1]);

943 
944  return 0;
945 }

void geoc2geod ( cartpos &  geoc,

Convert GEOC to GEOD.

Convert a Geocentric cartpos to a Geodetic geoidpos.

1005 {
1006  double e2;
1007  double st;
1008  double ct, cn, sn;
1009  double c, rp, a1, a2, a3, b1, b2, c1, c2, c3, rbc;
1010  double p, phi, h, nh, rn;
1011 
1012  // calculate geodetic longitude = atan2(py/px)
1013  geod.s.lon = atan2(geoc.s.col[1], geoc.s.col[0]);
1014 
1015  // Calculate effects of oblate spheroid
1016  // TODO: Explain math
1017  // e2 (square of first eccentricity) = 1 - (1 - f)^2
1018  e2 = (1. - FRATIO2);
1019  p = sqrt(geoc.s.col[0]*geoc.s.col[0] + geoc.s.col[1]*geoc.s.col[1]);
1020  nh = sqrt(p*p + geoc.s.col[2]*geoc.s.col[2]) - REARTHM;
1021  phi = atan2(geoc.s.col[2],p);
1022  do
1023  {
1024  h = nh;
1025  st = sin(phi);
1026  // rn = radius of curvature in the vertical prime
1027  rn = REARTHM / sqrt(1.-e2*st*st);
1028  nh = p/cos(phi) - rn;
1029  phi = atan( (geoc.s.col[2]/p)/(1.-e2*rn/(rn+h) ) );
1030  } while (fabs(nh-h) > .01);
1031 
1032  geod.s.lat = phi;
1033  geod.s.h = h;
1034 
1035  // TODO: Explain math
1036  st = sin(geod.s.lat);
1037  ct = cos(geod.s.lat);
1038  sn = sin(geod.s.lon);
1039  cn = cos(geod.s.lon);
1040 
1041  c = 1./sqrt(ct * ct + FRATIO2 * st *st);
1042  rp = geod.s.h + REARTHM * FRATIO2 * c * c * c;
1043  a1 = ct * cn;
1044  b1 = -geoc.s.col[1];
1045  c1 = -st * cn * rp;
1046  a2 = ct * sn;
1047  b2 = geoc.s.col[0];
1048  c2 = -st * sn * rp;
1049  a3 = st;
1050  c3 = ct * rp;
1051  rbc = (b1*c2 - b2*c1)/c3;
1052  geod.v.h = (b2 * geoc.v.col[0] - b1 * geoc.v.col[1] + rbc * geoc.v.col[2])/(b2 * a1 - b1 * a2 + rbc*a3);
1053  geod.v.lat = (geoc.v.col[2] - a3 * geod.v.h) / c3;
1054  if (fabs(b1) > fabs(b2))
1055  geod.v.lon = (geoc.v.col[0] - a1 * geod.v.h - c1 * geod.v.lat) / b1;
1056  else
1057  geod.v.lon = (geoc.v.col[1] - a2 * geod.v.h - c2 * geod.v.lat) / b2;
1058 }

void att_planec2lvlh ( locstruc *  loc)

Convert ITRS attitude to LVLH attitude.

Calculate the rotation quaternion for taking a vector from LVLH to Body given the similar quaternion for ITRS

Parameters
locLocation structure to propagate the changes in
1659 {
1660  quaternion qe_z = {{0.,0.,0.},1.}, qe_y = {{0.,0.,0.},1.}, fqe = {{0.,0.,0.},1.}, rqe = {{0.,0.,0.},1.};
1661  rvector lvlh_z = {{0.,0.,1.}}, lvlh_y = {{0.,1.,0.}}, geoc_z = {{0.}}, geoc_y = {{0.}}, alpha = {{0.}};
1662  qatt *patt;
1663  cartpos *ppos;
1664  double radius;
1665 
1666  switch (loc->pos.extra.closest)
1667  {
1668  case COSMOS_EARTH:
1669  default:
1670  patt = &loc->att.geoc;
1671  ppos = &loc->pos.geoc;
1672  break;
1673  case COSMOS_MOON:
1674  patt = &loc->att.selc;
1675  ppos = &loc->pos.selc;
1676  break;
1677  }
1678 
1679  radius = length_rv(ppos->s);
1680 
1681  // Update time
1682  loc->att.lvlh.utc = patt->utc = loc->utc;
1683 
1684  // Update pass
1685  loc->att.lvlh.pass = patt->pass;
1686 
1687  att_extra(loc);
1688 
1689  // LVLH Z is opposite of direction to satellite
1690  geoc_z = rv_smult(-1.,ppos->s);
1691  normalize_rv(geoc_z);
1692 
1693  // LVLH Y is Cross Product of LVLH Z and velocity vector
1694  geoc_y = rv_cross(geoc_z,ppos->v);
1695  normalize_rv(geoc_y);
1696 
1697  // Determine intrinsic rotation of ITRF Z into LVLH Z
1698  qe_z = q_conjugate(q_drotate_between_rv(geoc_z,lvlh_z));
1699 
1700  // Use to intrinsically rotate ITRF Y into intermediate Y
1701  // geoc_y = drotate(qe_z,geoc_y);
1702  geoc_y = irotate(qe_z,geoc_y);
1703 
1704  // Determine intrinsic rotation of this intermediate Y into LVLH Y
1705  qe_y = q_conjugate(q_drotate_between_rv(geoc_y,lvlh_y));
1706 
1707  // Combine to determine intrinsic rotation of ITRF into LVLH
1708  fqe = q_fmult(qe_z,qe_y);
1709  normalize_q(&fqe);
1710  rqe = q_conjugate(fqe);
1711 
1712  // Correct velocity for LVLH angular velocity wrt ITRS, expressed in ITRS
1713  alpha = rv_smult(1./(radius*radius),rv_cross(ppos->s,ppos->v));
1714  loc->att.lvlh.v = rv_sub(patt->v,alpha);
1715 
1716  // Transform ITRS into LVLH
1717  // loc->att.lvlh.s = q_fmult(patt->s,fqe);
1718  // loc->att.lvlh.v = irotate(fqe,loc->att.lvlh.v);
1719  // loc->att.lvlh.a = irotate(fqe,patt->a);
1720  loc->att.lvlh.s = q_fmult(rqe,patt->s);
1721  loc->att.lvlh.v = irotate(fqe,loc->att.lvlh.v);
1722  loc->att.lvlh.a = irotate(fqe,patt->a);

1771  qe_z = q_conjugate(q_drotate_between_rv(geoc_z,lvlh_z));
1772  geoc_z = irotate(qe_z,geoc_z);
1773 
1774  // Use to rotate LVLH Y into intermediate LVLH Y
1775  // geoc_y = drotate(qe_z,geoc_y);
1776  geoc_y = irotate(qe_z,geoc_y);
1777 
1778  // Determine rotation of this LVLH Y into ITRF Y
1779  qe_y = q_conjugate(q_drotate_between_rv(geoc_y,lvlh_y));
1780 
1781  // Multiply to determine transformation of ITRF frame into LVLH frame
1782  fqe = q_fmult(qe_z,qe_y);
1783  normalize_q(&fqe);
1784  rqe = q_conjugate(fqe);
1785 
1786  // LVLH Z is opposite of earth to satellite vector
1787  geoc_z = rv_smult(-1.,ppos->s);
1788  normalize_rv(geoc_z);
1789 
1790  // LVLH Y is Cross Product of LVLH Z and velocity vector
1791  geoc_y = rv_cross(geoc_z,ppos->v);
1792  normalize_rv(geoc_y);
1793 
1794  // Rotate LVLH frame into ITRS frame
1795  // patt->s = q_fmult(rqe,loc->att.lvlh.s);
1796  // patt->v = irotate(fqe,loc->att.lvlh.v);
1797  // patt->a = irotate(fqe,loc->att.lvlh.a);
1798  patt->s = q_fmult(fqe,loc->att.lvlh.s);
1799  patt->v = irotate(rqe,loc->att.lvlh.v);
1800  patt->a = irotate(rqe,loc->att.lvlh.a);
1801 
1802  // Correct velocity for LVLH angular velocity wrt ITRS, expressed in ITRS
1803  alpha = rv_smult(1./(radius*radius),rv_cross(ppos->s,ppos->v));
1804  patt->v = rv_add(patt->v,alpha);
1805 
1806  // Synchronize Topo
1807  att_planec2topo(loc);
1808 }

void kep2eci ( kepstruc &  kep,

2607 {
2608  rvector qpos = {{0.}}, qvel = {{0.}};
2609  double s1, s2, s3, c1, c2, c3;
2610  double xx, xy, xz, yx, yy, yz, zx, zy, zz;

2612 
2613  sea = sin(kep.ea);
2614  cea = cos(kep.ea);
2615  sqe = sqrt(1. - kep.e * kep.e);
2616 
2617  qpos.col[0] = kep.a * (cea - kep.e);
2618  qpos.col[1] = kep.a * sqe * sea;
2619  qpos.col[2] = 0.;
2620 
2621  // find mean motion and period
2622  kep.mm = sqrt(GM/pow(kep.a,3.));
2623  kep.period = 2. * DPI / kep.mm;
2624  qvel.col[0] = -kep.mm * kep.a * sea / (1. - kep.e*cea);
2625  qvel.col[1] = kep.mm * kep.a * sqe * cea / (1. - kep.e*cea);
2626  qvel.col[2] = 0.;
2627 
2628  s1 = sin(kep.raan);
2629  c1 = cos(kep.raan);
2630  s2 = sin(kep.i);
2631  c2 = cos(kep.i);
2632  s3 = sin(kep.ap);
2633  c3 = cos(kep.ap);
2634 
2635  xx = c1*c3 - s1*c2*s3;
2636  xy = -c1*s3 - s1*c2*c3;
2637  xz = s1*s2;
2638 
2639  yx = s1*c3 + c1*c2*s3;
2640  yy = -s1*s3 + c1*c2*c3;
2641  yz = -c1*s2;
2642 
2643  zx = s2*s3;
2644  zy = s2*c3;
2645  zz = c2;

2651  eci.s.col[2] = qpos.col[0] * zx + qpos.col[1] * zy + qpos.col[2] * zz;

2654  eci.v.col[1] = qvel.col[0] * yx + qvel.col[1] * yy + qvel.col[2] * yz;
2655  eci.v.col[2] = qvel.col[0] * zx + qvel.col[1] * zy + qvel.col[2] * zz;

void eci2kep ( cartpos &  eci,
kepstruc &  kep 
)
2661 {
2662  double magr, magv, magn, sme, rdotv, temp;
2663  double c1, hk, magh;
2664  rvector nbar = {{0.}}, ebar = {{0.}}, rsun = {{0.}}, hsat = {{0.}};
2665  cartpos earthpos;
2666 
2667  kep.utc = eci.utc;
2668 
2669  magr = length_rv(eci.s);
2670  if (magr < D_SMALL)
2671  magr = D_SMALL;
2672  magv = length_rv(eci.v);
2673  if (magv < D_SMALL)
2674  magv = D_SMALL;
2675  kep.h = rv_cross(eci.s,eci.v);
2676  if (magr == D_SMALL && magv == D_SMALL)
2677  kep.fa = acos(1./D_SMALL);
2678  else
2679  kep.fa = acos(length_rv(kep.h)/(magr*magv));
2680  kep.eta = magv*magv/2. - GM/magr;
2681  magh = length_rv(kep.h);
2682  jplpos(JPL_EARTH,JPL_SUN_BARY,utc2tt(eci.utc),&earthpos);
2683  rsun = earthpos.s;
2684  normalize_rv(rsun);
2685  hsat = kep.h;
2686  normalize_rv(hsat);
2687  kep.beta = asin(dot_rv(rsun,hsat));
2688 
2689  if (magh > O_SMALL)
2690  {
2691  // ------------ find a e and semi-latus rectum ----------
2692  nbar.col[0] = -kep.h.col[1];
2693  nbar.col[1] = kep.h.col[0];
2694  nbar.col[2] = 0.0;
2695  magn = length_rv(nbar);
2696  c1 = magv * magv - GM / magr;
2697  rdotv = dot_rv(eci.s,eci.v);
2698  ebar.col[0] = (c1 * eci.s.col[0] - rdotv * eci.v.col[0]) / GM;
2699  ebar.col[1] = (c1 * eci.s.col[1] - rdotv * eci.v.col[1]) / GM;
2700  ebar.col[2] = (c1 * eci.s.col[2] - rdotv * eci.v.col[2]) / GM;
2701  kep.e = length_rv(ebar);
2702 
2703  sme = (magv * magv * 0.5) - (GM / magr);
2704  if (fabs(sme) > O_SMALL)
2705  kep.a = -GM / (2. * sme);
2706  else
2707  kep.a = O_INFINITE;
2708  // p = magh * magh / GM;
2709 
2710  // find mean motion and period
2711  kep.mm = sqrt(GM/pow(kep.a,3.));
2712  kep.period = 2. * DPI / kep.mm;
2713 
2714  // ----------------- find inclination -------------------
2715  hk = kep.h.col[2] / magh;
2716  kep.i = acos(hk);
2717 
2718  // ---------- find longitude of ascending node ------------
2719  if (magn > O_SMALL)
2720  {
2721  temp = nbar.col[0] / magn;
2722  if (fabs(temp) > 1.)
2723  temp = temp<1.?-1.:(temp>1.?1.:0.);
2724  kep.raan = acos(temp);
2725  if (nbar.col[1] < 0.)
2726  kep.raan = D2PI - kep.raan;
2727  }
2728  else
2729  kep.raan = O_UNDEFINED;
2730 
2731  // Find eccentric and mean anomaly
2732  kep.ea = atan2(rdotv/sqrt(kep.a*GM),1.-magr/kep.a);
2733  kep.ma = kep.ea - kep.e*sin(kep.ea);
2734 
2735  // Find argument of latitude
2736  kep.alat = atan2(eci.s.col[2],(eci.s.col[1]*kep.h.col[0]-eci.s.col[0]*kep.h.col[1])/magh);
2737 
2738  // Find true anomaly
2739  kep.ta = atan2(sqrt(1-kep.e*kep.e)*sin(kep.ea),cos(kep.ea)-kep.e);
2740 
2741  // Find argument of perigee
2742  kep.ap = kep.alat - kep.ta;
2743  }
2744  else
2745  {
2746  kep.a = kep.e = kep.i = kep.raan = O_UNDEFINED;
2747  kep.ap = kep.alat = kep.ma = kep.ta = kep.ea = kep.mm = O_UNDEFINED;
2748  }

Geocentric to Topocentric.

Calculate the Topocentric position of a Target with respect to a Source.

2766  slon = sin(source.lon);

2771  g2t.row[0].col[1] = clon;
2772  g2t.row[0].col[2] = 0.;
2773  g2t.row[1].col[0] = -slat*clon;
2774  g2t.row[1].col[1] = -slat*slon;
2775  g2t.row[1].col[2] = clat;
2776  g2t.row[2].col[0] = clat*clon;

2779

2781  st = sin(source.lat);
2782  c = 1./sqrt(ct * ct + FRATIO2 * st * st);
2783  s = FRATIO2 * c;
2784  r = (REARTHM * c + source.h) * ct;
2785  sourcegeoc.col[2] = (REARTHM * s + source.h) * st;
2786

2788  cs = cos(lst);
2789  ss = sin(lst);
2790  sourcegeoc.col[0] = r * cs;
2791  sourcegeoc.col[1] = r * ss;
2792

2864  if (tle.utc != lutc || tle.snumber != lsnumber)

2867  // FROM INPUT ELEMENTS
2868  a1=pow((SGP4_XKE/ tle.mm ),SGP4_TOTHRD);

2870  theta2=cosio * cosio;
2871  x3thm1 =3.*theta2-1.;
2872  eosq = tle.e * tle.e;
2873  betao2=1.- eosq;
2874  betao=sqrt(betao2);
2875  del1=1.5*SGP4_CK2*x3thm1 /(a1*a1*betao*betao2);
2876  ao=a1*(1.-del1*(.5*SGP4_TOTHRD+del1*(1.+134./81.*del1)));
2877  delo=1.5*SGP4_CK2*x3thm1 /(ao*ao*betao*betao2);

2879  aodp=ao/(1.-delo);
2880  // INITIALIZATION
2881  // FOR PERIGEE LESS THAN 220 KILOMETERS, THE isimp FLAG IS SET AND
2882  // THE EQUATIONS ARE TRUNCATED TO LINEAR VARIATION IN sqrt A AND
2883  // QUADRATIC VARIATION IN MEAN ANOMALY. ALSO, THE c3 TERM, THE
2884  // DELTA alpha TERM, AND THE DELTA M TERM ARE DROPPED.
2885  isimp=0;
2886  if((aodp*(1.- tle.e)/SGP4_AE) < (220./SGP4_XKMPER+SGP4_AE))
2887  isimp=1;
2888  // FOR PERIGEE BELOW 156 KM, THE VALUES OF
2889  // S AND SGP4_QOMS2T ARE ALTERED
2890  s4=SGP4_S;

2896  if(perige <= 98.)

2898  s4=20.;
2899  qoms24=pow(((120.-s4)*SGP4_AE/SGP4_XKMPER),4.);
2900  s4=s4/SGP4_XKMPER+SGP4_AE;
2901  }
2902  }
2903  pinvsq = 1./(aodp*aodp*betao2*betao2);
2904  tsi =1./(aodp-s4);
2905  eta=aodp* tle.e * tsi;

2907  eeta= tle.e *eta;
2908  psisq=fabs(1.-etasq);
2909  coef=qoms24*pow(tsi,4.);
2910  coef1=coef/pow(psisq,3.5);
2911  c2=coef1* xnodp *(aodp*(1.+1.5*etasq+eeta*(4.+etasq))+.75* SGP4_CK2*tsi/psisq*x3thm1 *(8.+3.*etasq*(8.+etasq)));

2925  omgdot =-.5* temp1*x1m5th+.0625* temp2*(7.-114.*theta2+ 395.*theta4)+ temp3*(3.-36.*theta2+49.*theta4);
2926  xhdot1 =- temp1*cosio;
2927  xnodot =xhdot1+(.5* temp2*(4.-19.*theta2)+2.* temp3*(3.- 7.*theta2))*cosio;
2928  omgcof = tle.bstar *c3*cos( tle.ap );
2929  xmcof =-SGP4_TOTHRD*coef* tle.bstar *SGP4_AE/eeta;
2930  xnodcf =3.5*betao2*xhdot1*c1;
2931  t2cof =1.5*c1;
2932  xlcof =.125*g*sinio *(3.+5.*cosio )/(1.+cosio );
2933  aycof =.25*g*sinio;

2935  sinmo =sin( tle.ma );

2938  {
2939  c1sq=c1*c1;
2940  d2=4.*aodp*tsi*c1sq;
2941  temp =d2*tsi*c1/3.;
2942  d3=(17.*aodp+s4)* temp;

2984  temp =1./(a*beta*beta);

3004  }

3006  ecose= temp5+ temp6;
3007  esine= temp3- temp4;
3008  elsq=axn*axn+ayn*ayn;

3025  temp2= temp1* temp;
